title: The Need for Assertive Communication
content: Assertive communication means stating concerns clearly and directly, regardless of hierarchy or social pressure. In high-reliability operations, silence kills. When you see a problem, saying nothing makes you part of the problem. Assertiveness isn't rudeness—it's responsibility.

mcq.question: You notice a senior operator about to make an error. You're new to the team. What should you do?

options.A: Stay quiet—you might be wrong and they're experienced
options.C: Mention it later if it causes a problem
options.D: Tell someone else to address it

mcq.explanation: Hesitation costs time and potentially safety. Your experience level doesn't change what you observed. Speak up directly: 'I see X, which concerns me because Y.' Let them evaluate your input.

openQuestions: What makes you hesitate to speak up about concerns?
How does your organization respond when junior people raise concerns?
